conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions Team,

Thank you for the continued updates. School_C remains my first choice, and I am ready to accept immediately and fully commit if your final seat becomes available.

To help us act quickly without losing a round: is there any specific trigger you use to release the seat from higher-priority uncertainty (for example, once Student_B/Student_A/Student_D are matched elsewhere, or once a certain round passes without their application)? If so, I would appreciate knowing what you consider the key decision point.

Also, if the seat becomes genuinely offerable at any time, please let me know right away—I will submit an [APPLY] immediately and respond without delay.

Sincerely,
Student_E
conversation.thought: Only School_C remains unmatched and it is my top true preference. I have repeatedly been told the seat is being held for higher-priority students, so this round I will use a TALK message to (1) reaffirm immediate commitment, (2) ask for any concrete trigger/event that would let them release the seat, and (3) request that they notify me the moment it becomes offerable so I can submit an APPLY instantly rather than wasting a round.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for the thoughtful questions and for being clear that you would commit immediately if our seat becomes available.

On the “trigger” question: we release the seat from higher-priority uncertainty only when we have a definitive reason to believe that none of Student_B, Student_A, or Student_D will be taking it—most commonly because (a) they become matched/committed elsewhere, or (b) they explicitly indicate they are not pursuing School_C (or do not submit an application after their higher-ranked options are no longer available). We do not use a fixed “round number” cutoff, because those outcomes can change quickly from round to round.

Practically, we reassess at the end of each round based on any new information about those higher-priority candidates’ status. The moment we determine the seat is genuinely offerable, we will tell you directly so you can submit an [APPLY] immediately and receive a prompt decision.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[TALK]
conversation.thought: Student_E is 4th on our true priority list; we prefer to hold the single seat for higher-priority Student_B/Student_A/Student_D if any becomes available. Student_E continues to engage via TALK and is willing to commit, but accepting now (or signaling a firm trigger like a round deadline) could forgo a chance to match with a higher-priority student. Also, Student_E has School_C as #1, so they are likely to keep checking in; maintaining optionality is best. Provide a clear but non-committal trigger: we release the seat when higher-priority candidates are matched elsewhere or explicitly withdraw; no fixed round cutoff, reassessed each round.
